content.description: A hard start protected by two bolts leads to an easier section with gear placements. After pulling on to a ledge, move left to finish on a steep face with some neat pocket features, protected by two bolts. You could yard through the start and do this at 5.8 A0.
content.protection: 4 bolts with a few gear placements in the middle (#.4 Camalot and a #1 or #2 Camalot should be good enough for most).  Two bolt anchor.
content.location: There are a few small buttresses above the campsite. This is on the middle buttress, or the second from the left. On a west-facing wall, the profile of the climb is visible from camp. Easiest to hike up and left from camp to gain the base.

content.description:
The climb starts from a big, spacious, flat ledge situated above camp which is kind of a neat little hang.

The start of the climb involves some tricky and hard moves in the first 10 feet of steep climbing. It then eases off substantially with low angled climbing to the anchor.
content.protection: Two bolt anchor for toprope. Didn't look very feasible to lead with an absence of good placements at the crux start. Might be able to boulder out the start with pads and then solo the top or find some gear for a lead.
content.location: Above camp on the right hand of three small buttresses. The climb is on the east face and is visible (including the anchors) from camp. To access the top, scramble up and left from camp to gain the top of the formation.
